title: Lemon Garlic Shrimp Scampi With Kale And Polenta
summary: Lemon Garlic Shrimp Scampi With Kale And Polentan is a gluten free and pescatarian main course. For $5.7 per serving, this recipe covers 39% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains around 52g of protein, 28g of fat, and a total of 652 calories. This recipe serves 3. 4 people have tried and liked this recipe. If you have kosher salt and ground pepper, olive oil, parmesan cheese, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the butter you could follow this main course with the Cinnamon Butter Cake as a dessert. Only a few people really liked this Mediterranean dish. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 14 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 79%. This score is pretty good. Similar recipes are Shrimp Scampi with Quick Preserved Lemon and Fennel on Polenta, Cajun Garlic Lemon Butter Shrimp with Caramelized Corn Polenta, and Lobster Scampi over Creamy Polenta with Garlic Chips.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. The St. Michael-Eppan Anger Pinot Grigio with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 23 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: St. Michael-Eppan Anger Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Depending on the soil and microclimate, Pinot gris varies from a simple everyday wine all the way up to absolute top growths. The warm, sun-exposed vineyards of the Anger sites, with their loamy limestone gravel soils, are a textbook example. The Anger Alto Adige Pinot Grigio has a noble structure, nice balance and fine acidity â€“ making it an absolute pleasure to drink. The strong white goes well with fish and fish soup, guinea fowl breast or veal fillet.
